meanings.definition: A secondary index within a larger index.
meanings.sent1: The subindex helped me find the specific information I needed in the big book.
meanings.sent2: I used the subindex at the back of the textbook to locate the chapter quickly.
meanings.sent3: The subindex was like a treasure map leading me to the hidden knowledge.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a subindex of facts, neatly organized and easy to access.
meanings.sent5: The subindex acted as a guide, pointing me in the right direction within the index.

meanings.definition: To create a subindex within a larger index.
meanings.sent1: I will subindex the important sections to make them easier to find later.
meanings.sent2: She subindexed the key terms in the document for quick reference.
meanings.sent3: He subindexed the data like a librarian organizing books on a shelf.
meanings.sent4: The software subindexes the files automatically, saving time and effort.
meanings.sent5: Subindexing the content will streamline the search process for users.
